batchRevokeAttestations(address,bytes32[.details: Throws if the number of identifiers and accounts is not the sameThrows if sender is not the issuer or currently registered signer of issuerThrows if an attestation is not found for identifiers[i] <-> accounts[i]

params.accounts: Addresses of the accounts mapped to the identifiers  at the same indices
params.issuer: Address of the issuer of all attestations to be revoked

params.test: Set to true to skip implementation initialization

getVersionNumber().return: The storage, major, minor, and patch version of the contract.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

lookupAttestations(bytes32,address[]).details: Adds attestation info to the arrays in order of provided trustedIssuersExpectation that only one attestation exists per (identifier, issuer, account)

params.trustedIssuers: Array of n issuers whose attestations will be included

lookupAttestations(bytes32,address[]).return: countsPerIssuer Array of number of attestations returned per issuer         For m (== sum([0])) found attestations: accounts Array of m accounts signers Array of m signersissuedOns Array of m issuedOnspublishedOns Array of m publishedOns

lookupIdentifiers(address,address[]).details: Adds identifier info to the arrays in order of provided trustedIssuersExpectation that only one attestation exists per (identifier, issuer, account)

params.trustedIssuers: Array of n issuers whose identifier mappings will be used

lookupIdentifiers(address,address[]).return: countsPerIssuer Array of number of identifiers returned per issueridentifiers Array (length == sum([0])) of identifiers

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerAttestation(bytes32,address,addr.details: Throws if an attestation with the same (identifier, issuer, account) already exists

params.account: Address of the account being mapped to the identifier
params.identifier: Hash of the identifier to be attested
params.issuedOn: Time at which the issuer issued the attestation in Unix time
params.r: Output value r of the ECDSA signature
params.s: Output value s of the ECDSA signature
params.signer: Address of the signer of the attestation
params.v: The recovery id of the incoming ECDSA signature

registerAttestationAsIssuer(bytes32,addr.details: Attestation signer and issuer in storage is set to msg.senderThrows if an attestation with the same (identifier, issuer, account) already exists

params.account: Address of the account being mapped to the identifier
params.identifier: Hash of the identifier to be attested
params.issuedOn: Time at which the issuer issued the attestation in Unix time

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokeAttestation(bytes32,address,addres.details: Throws if sender is not the issuer, signer, or account

params.account: Address of the account mapped to the identifier
params.identifier: Hash of the identifier to be revoked

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

validateAttestationSig(bytes32,address,a.details: Throws if attestation has been revokedThrows if signer is not an authorized AttestationSigner of the issuer

params.account: Address of the account being mapped to the identifier
params.identifier: Hash of the identifier to be attested
params.issuedOn: Time at which the issuer issued the attestation in Unix time
params.r: Output value r of the ECDSA signature
params.s: Output value s of the ECDSA signature
params.signer: Address of the signer of the attestation
params.v: The recovery id of the incoming ECDSA signature

methods.constructor: Sets initialized == true on implementation contracts

getVersionNumber().notice: Returns the storage, major, minor, and patch version of the contract.

initialize().notice: Used in place of the constructor to allow the contract to be upgradable via proxy.

lookupAttestations(bytes32,address[]).notice: Returns info about attestations for `identifier` produced by    signers of `trustedIssuers`

lookupIdentifiers(address,address[]).notice: Returns identifiers mapped to `account` by signers of `trustedIssuers`

registerAttestation(bytes32,address,addr.notice: Registers an attestation with a valid signature

registerAttestationAsIssuer(bytes32,addr.notice: Registers an attestation directly from the issuer

validateAttestationSig(bytes32,address,a.notice: Validates the given attestation and signature
